title: 115_hr4842
content: The Act is titled the "Streamlining Permitting to Enable Efficient Deployment of Broadband Infrastructure Act of 2018." It amends Title I of the Communications Act of 1934 to include an exemption from review for certain communications facilities. The Act, titled the "Streamlining Permitting to Enable Efficient Deployment of Broadband Infrastructure Act of 2018," exempts the Commission from performing or requiring reviews under the National Environmental Policy Act for permitting communication facilities within public right-of-ways under specific height limits. The Act exempts the Commission from environmental reviews for permitting communication facilities within public right-of-ways under specific height limits, including replacements for existing facilities, small antennas, and limited expansions of existing sites. The Act exempts the Commission from environmental reviews for communication facilities within public right-of-ways under specific height limits. This does not affect the obligation to evaluate radiofrequency exposure under the National Environmental Policy Act or the authority of State or local governments to enforce zoning regulations. The Act exempts the Commission from environmental reviews for communication facilities within public right-of-ways under specific height limits. No review is required under the National Environmental Policy Act or division A of subtitle III of title 54, United States Code, for granting a covered easement for a communications facility on Federal property. Definitions include 'antenna' as communications equipment transmitting or receiving electromagnetic radio signals. The term 'communications facility' includes infrastructure and equipment for wireless or wireline transmission of various data types, as well as antennas designed for emitting or receiving radio frequency signals. The term 'covered easement' refers to an easement, right-of-way, or lease on federal property, excluding tribal land held in trust by the Federal Government, for communication facilities that are fixed in location and authorized by the Commission. The term 'public right-of-way' refers to the area on, below, or above a public roadway, highway, street, sidewalk, or similar property, including any adjacent land within the right-of-way grant, but excluding portions of the Interstate System. The term 'support pole' refers to an upright structure used to support a wireless service facility. 'Utility facility' includes privately, publicly, or cooperatively owned systems for producing, transmitting, or distributing various commodities. 'Wireless service' involves radio transmission of voice, video, or data communications services. The term 'wireless service facility' refers to a facility for providing wireless service.
